skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: How to properly create Claude Code skills - teaches global vs project-local, naming conventions, and proper file structure
skill.summary: How to properly create Claude Code skills - teaches global vs project-local, naming conventions, and...
skill.author: ChinchillaEnterprises

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown content. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable reads are present. The file teaches skill creation best practices through instructional content and example commands.

content.value_statement: Creating skills without proper structure causes errors and confusion. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for naming, file structure, and deployment. Follow these rules to ensure your skills work correctly and can be shared across projects.
actual_capabilities: Teaches global vs project-local skill placement and when to use each
Provides step-by-step instructions for creating new skills
Explains YAML frontmatter requirements for skill discovery
Shows how to commit and push skills to the ChillSkills repository
Includes decision tree for determining skill scope and location
limitations: Does not create skills automatically - provides guidance for manual creation
Does not execute any code or modify files on your system
Focuses on skill creation workflow, not skill content development
Does not validate existing skills or fix broken configurations

use_cases.title: Create your first skill
use_cases.description: Follow step-by-step instructions to set up your skill directory and write proper YAML frontmatter for Claude Code discovery.

use_cases.title: Share skills across projects
use_cases.description: Learn when to use global versus project-local skills. Deploy reusable skills that work across all your repositories.

use_cases.title: Maintain skill quality
use_cases.description: Apply best practices for naming, structure, and versioning. Keep your skills organized and easy for others to use.

output_examples.input: Help me create a new skill for code reviews
output: Creating a code-review skill? Great choice! Let me guide you through the proper setup.
First, decide on the skill name: code-review (already follows lowercase-with-hyphens convention).
Next, determine where to place it: This skill works on any repository, so it belongs in your global skills directory at ~/.claude/skills/code-review/SKILL.md.
Then create the SKILL.md file with required YAML frontmatter including name and description fields.
Finally, commit to ChillSkills to share this skill across your machines and with the community.

best_practices: Always place skills in ~/.claude/skills/ by default - only use project-local skills when truly project-specific.
Include YAML frontmatter at the very top of SKILL.md with name and description fields for proper discovery.
Commit and push global skills to the ChillSkills repository for version control and cross-machine access.
anti_patterns: Creating skills in .claude/skills/ by default - this is for rare project-specific cases only.
Using underscores instead of hyphens in skill names - always use lowercase-with-hyphens.
Skipping YAML frontmatter - skills without it will not be discovered or activated by Claude Code.

faq.question: What tools support Claude Code skills?
faq.answer: Skills work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool discovers skills through voice or text activation phrases like use your skill-name skill.

faq.question: What are the skill name and file limits?
faq.answer: Skill names must be 64 characters or less. Descriptions must be 1024 characters or less. The skill file must be named SKILL.md exactly.

faq.question: How do I integrate skills into my workflow?
faq.answer: Skills are activated by mentioning them in natural language. Say or type: Use your skill-name skill to [task description]. Claude then applies the skill's guidance.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only documentation - it does not read files, access networks, or execute any code. It teaches best practices through written guidance.

faq.question: My skill is not working - what should I check?
faq.answer: First verify YAML frontmatter exists at the file top. Confirm the skill file is named SKILL.md. Check that the name field matches your directory name. Restart Claude Code to reload skills.
